bugs
Class Bug

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      bugs.Bug
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Bug
extends java.lang.Thread

A class representing a Bug that provides methods for interpreting the Bug's programming following the Bugs Grammar.

Author:
theresabreiner

public Bug(tree.Tree<Token> p,
           Interpreter intr)
Constructor for a Bug object that sets the x, y, and angle instance variables to default 0.0 each and initializes the variableMap to record other variables and their values.

public double evaluate(tree.Tree<Token> tree)
Evaluates the tree based on the operation in its root node. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the root node does not contain an operation or comparison or terminal numeric value.

Parameters:
tree -

interpret

public void interpret(tree.Tree<Token> tree)
Interprets the tree based on the keyword in its root node. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the keyword is invalid.

Parameters:
tree -

store

public void store(java.lang.String variable,
                  double value)
Takes the given variable and maps it to its value in whichever map on the stack it has been declared in, including checking the allbugs variables. If the variable is either "x", "y", or "angle", does not insert them into the map, but updates this Bug's instance variables. Throws a RuntimeException if the variable has not been declared in any of the maps on the stack or in the allbugs variables.

Parameters:
variable -
value -

fetch

public double fetch(java.lang.String variable)
Looks up the given variable's value in the different variable maps on the stack, starting from the top going down until it finds the variable defined. Also checks the allbugs variables. If the variable is either "x", "y" or "angle", does not look in map but just returns the corresponding instance variable's value. Throws a RuntimeException if the variable is not in any of the maps on the stack or in the allbugs variables.

Parameters:
variable -
Returns:
double value of the given variable

distance

public double distance(java.lang.String nameOfBug)
Method to calculate the distance from this bug to the named bug. Throws a RuntimeException if the named bug is not in the Interpreter's list of Bugs.

Parameters:
nameOfBug - as a String
Returns:
double distance from this bug to named bug

direction

public double direction(java.lang.String nameOfBug)
Method to calculate the angle from this bug to the named bug. Throws a RuntimeException if the named bug is not in the Interpreter's list of Bugs.

Parameters:
nameOfBug - as a String
Returns:
double distance from this bug to named bug

run

public void run()
This run method waits for permission to work and then begins interpreting this bug's program. Within the interpret implementation the bug repeatedly informs the interpreter that it has completed an action and then waits for another work permit. Once the bug's program has been completely interpreted, the bug tells the interpreter and is terminated.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
Thread.run()
